hypothesis_content.title: Regime Transition Momentum Fade on Failed Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC attempts a regime transition from NEUTRAL to BULL via a 5% breakout above the 20-day high, but fails to sustain momentum (RSI(14) < 55 within 48 hours), a mean reversion back to NEUTRAL range occurs with 70% probability within 5 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Failed breakouts in neutral regimes often trap momentum traders. High volume breakouts that quickly lose momentum suggest institutional selling into strength or lack of follow-through. Regulatory uncertainty periods (like current MiCA implementation) create hesitation at key levels.
entry_conditions: Volume on breakout day > 20-day avg volume by 30%
Regime transitions from NEUTRAL to BULL on breakout

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price returns to pre-breakout 20-day range midpoint (+/- 1.5%)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC closes > breakout high by 2% (breakout confirmation)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 30% of such failed breakouts continue to new highs within 5 days instead of mean reverting.
